instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: Hi I’m just revisiting my last four <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi I have 4 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had 1/4 fan spin 
I’ve done some work on and 1 actually booted and died after with 3 beeps the other 2 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>’s start to boot but hang 1.04v on cpuvcore. My magesafe power supply says it starts drawing 1.23amps and when fans spins high it draws 1.43amps from MagSafe.
these three have a fan spinning full speed after a few seconds oftrying to boot.

threads.title: Hi I’m just revisiting my last four <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try one good DDR module on each slot at a time.
Do you note any voltage drop on VCORE, after 5-10s?

threads.title: Hi I’m just revisiting my last four <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I tried several test ram and nothing same issue. That’s the thing it’s steady 1.05v And I usually see it Go from 1.05 - .825V on a working board. I’ve checked all my <CHIP>U7801</CHIP> for enables and I have 1.05v.

threads.title: Hi I’m just revisiting my last four <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You can change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, just in case.
Or apply hardware mod to disable GPU.

threads.title: Hi I’m just revisiting my last four <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Ok will try this. It seem some bouncing in 10sec it goes down to.999v but not lower than that 
Ok so hardware mod is a bios disable gpu for 2010
